solution_line_template: The buffet cost for Mr. Smith and his wife is ${adult_buffet_price} x {num_adults} = $<<{adult_buffet_price}*{num_adults}={adult_total}>>{adult_total}.
The buffet cost for his children is ${child_buffet_price} x {num_children} = $<<{child_buffet_price}*{num_children}={children_total}>>{children_total}.

The buffet cost for 1 senior citizen is ${adult_buffet_price} x {senior_discount_percent}% = $<<{adult_buffet_price}*{senior_discount_percent}*{percent_factor}={senior_buffet_price}>>{senior_buffet_price}.
Buffet cost for the grandparents is ${senior_buffet_price} x {num_seniors} = $<<{senior_buffet_price}*{num_seniors}={seniors_total}>>{seniors_total}.
Buffet cost for the entire family is ${adult_total} + ${children_total} + ${seniors_total} = $<<{adult_total}+{children_total}+{seniors_total}={family_total}>>{family_total}
